content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It took a minute to figure out the formula because as the number of digits increase the number of possible combinations increase exponentially so you have to figure out a way around that and if you are not doing it properly you could have a problem with optimization. Overall I thought this was a fun problem that was too easy to be a puzzle and a really good fit for a clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Solving it was fun.
It took a while figuring out the formula, so its a bit hard, not to hard and not too easy, perfect.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle but not for clash.
Like i understand when i found formula but i think most of people don't find it and then use bruteforce method

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This problem isn't really that hard; I'll probably place it on medium. I spent about a minute finding a formula, and then a minute or two implementing that formula. Basically, this clash is balanced as in if one can derive the formula they can implement and win, but if one couldn't derive it then they can still get at least some but not all of the test cases.

Overall, this clash looks good to me.

This is a very interesting problem, but its too hard for a clash. I was working on it for 30ish minutes and never figured it out. This is mainly because I am dumb and don't know math but chances are most other people don't know the formula either.

One suggestion I have is to just make the clash brute force-able. That way, even if people don't know the simple way of doing it they can still get the answer.

Goal section
* Please change [[n=3]] to [[n]]={{3}}.

* Please change [[digits=[1,2]]] to [[digits]]={{1 2}}.

Input section
* Please add "of space-separated" between "list" and "digits".

Output section
* Please change N to n, and then format it as a [[variable]].

Constraints section
* You haven't included any case where d_i = 0. If you're going to add such cases, you have to clarify the rules of forming the numbers (0 can be leading or not?). If you aren't, please fix the constraint.

Stub generator
* Please change line 2 to use loopline instead.

Thanks.

Hi 5DN1L,
Thanks for your precise comments. I integrated all the modifications you suggested.

Oh, I though using loopline like this - loopline 1 digits:int - would solve the problem but it's not working well. I would like not to define a third variable being the number of digits in the list, is there a way to do this ?
Yes, you have to include a third variable... If you'd rather not, then you're stuck with the string option.
